intro: Strophopappus riedelianus, commonly known as the Riedel's erigeron, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and purple. It is often found in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ecological importance includes providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to local biodiversity.
